intro: Centaurium oxyphyllum, commonly known as the mountain centaury, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Gentianaceae family, known for its striking blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. Its flowers are tubular and often have five lobes, with prominent stamens and a single pistil. Centaurium oxyphyllum is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional herbal medicine for various purposes.
